ASIA Markets buoyant, but China PMIs awaitA look at the day ahead in Asian markets. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 21:48:08 GMT KLG3OSCQV5PITP66ZETP76T6IE https://www.reuters.com/markets/asia/global-markets-view-asia-graphic-pix-2024-02-29/Jamie McGeever市场亚洲市场
China home prices likely to fall 0.9% this year; previous poll tipped growth: Reuters pollNew home prices in China are likely to fall this year due to limited effect of ongoing government support measures, a Reuters poll showed, with economists predicting the ailing market will need more than a year to bottom out. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 21:04:48 GMT Z2TRVAVA5BLHHA3ZEVCCCCBQI4 https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-home-prices-likely-to-fall-09-this-year-previous-poll-tipped-growth-2024-02-29/Liangping Gao, Ryan Woo世界中国
Russian man who smuggled military technology to Russia pleads guilty in US courtA Russian man pled guilty on Thursday to U.S. charges that he smuggled large quantities of American-made, military-grade microelectronics to Russia, top U.S. justice officials said in a statement. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 20:46:53 GMT BFEGSE6L7FJTNJIKHI5NGL5E5I https://www.reuters.com/world/us/ Russian-man-who-smuggled-military-technology-Russia-pleads-guilty-us-court-2024-02-29/Reuters世界美国
Boeing to pay $51 million in settlement for US export violationsBoeing Co has agreed to pay $51 million in a settlement with the U.S. State Department for unauthorized exports of technical data, including to China, the department said on Thursday. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 20:32:02 GMT APB4PY5W6JND7DDKRLK6BJWHJY https://www.reuters.com/business/aerospace-defense/boeing-pays-51-million-settlement-us-export-violations-2024-02-29/Reuters商业航空航天与国防
US trade chief: 'Complex trade-offs' needed at WTO talksU.S. Trade Representative Katherine Tai said on Friday breakthroughs were still possible in overnight negotiations at the World Trade Organization, but "complex trade-offs" would be needed even for less difficult topics such as fishing. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 19:15:07 GMT YODSTO3SRVOUJHOULOJLQCI3IM https://www.reuters.com/world/us-trade-chief-complex-trade-offs-needed-wto-talks-2024-02-29/Emma Farge世界
Chinese outbound investment in EVs likely set new record in 2023Chinese outbound foreign direct investment along the electric vehicle value chain likely set a new record in 2023, a report from Rhodium Group showed, as western economies step up scrutiny of China's production-focussed, debt driven development model. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 14:05:59 GMT XJN2ZAD4FRLXXHAXFEJHEIJIPI https://www.reuters.com/business/chinese-outbound-investment-likely-to-set-new-record-2023-2024-02-29/Joe Cash商业
Fisheries deal at WTO insufficient for Pacific islands, Fiji saysA grouping of Pacific islands, including Fiji, Papua New Guinea and the Solomon Islands, are opposing a draft deal on changes to fisheries subsidies at the World Trade Organization talks in Abu Dhabi, arguing that it does not go far enough. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 12:58:58 GMT AFGVE24LB5MALLRKSAJBBUHXIY https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/fisheries-deal-wto-insufficient-pacific-islands-fiji-says-2024-02-29/Alexander Cornwell世界亚太地区
Chinese retailers further discount iPhone 15Major Chinese third-party retailers JD.com , TMall, and Pinduoduo are battling for customers by offering more steep discounts on Apple's iPhone 15 just five months after launch, as the U.S. tech company suffers slowing sales in China. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 12:31:16 GMT A4ZAFZMNKZNLNPWY7VKNX5文件https://www.reuters.com/world/china/chinese-retailers-further-discount-iphone-15-2024-02-29/Yelin Mo, Brenda Goh世界中国
Germany wants Big Tech to pay towards compliance costs of new digital lawGermany wants Big Tech companies Alphabet , Amazon , Apple , ByteDance, Meta Platforms and Microsoft to contribute towards the compliance costs of new European Union rules aimed at curbing their power, a senior German economy ministry official said on Thursday.
